newFeatures.text: Hall of Fame - Celebrate your achievements! New Hall of Fame view showcases global leaderboard champions and your personal accomplishments across all levels. Three main views: 'Top Players' shows the top 20 global competitors with their total scores, levels completed, and championship counts; 'Your Stats' displays your personal achievements including levels completed, average ranking, best scores, and detailed breakdown per level; 'Level Records' highlights the top 3 champions for each individual level with gold/silver/bronze medals. Accessible from the levels menu. See who's dominating the leaderboards, track your progress, and get motivated to improve your scores! ðŸ†

Username Authentication System - Your leaderboard identity is now secure! Each device gets a unique authentication token, allowing you to claim a username that's permanently tied to your device. No more impersonation - only you can post scores under your name. You can change your username anytime through a simple confirmation dialog, and all your existing leaderboard entries automatically migrate to your new name. Old usernames remain reserved to prevent confusion. This establishes trust and competitive integrity for the leaderboard system. Seamless setup on first launch with optional 'Remember my name' feature.

ROM Editor Graphical Mode - Revolutionary new way to edit ROM data! Click individual bits to toggle them on/off using intuitive colored dots (red for high, dark for low). Visual grid pattern makes it easy to track bits. Works seamlessly alongside text-based modes (Binary, HEX, Decimal).

Eraser Tool (Mobile) - Toggleable eraser mode for rapid circuit cleanup! Tap the always-visible trash icon to activate eraser mode, then drag your finger over components/wires to delete them continuously. Two modes available: 'Delete All' removes everything you touch, 'Wires Only' preserves components. Tap the top banner to switch modes. Camera panning disabled while erasing to prevent accidents. Huge productivity boost for mobile editing!

Discord Rich Presence (PC) - Show off your Digital Logic Sim activity on Discord! Enable 'Discord Status' in Settings to display your current activity to friends. Shows what level you're playing, whether you're building circuits or running simulations, and your current progress. Perfect for sharing your learning journey and connecting with other DLS players on Discord. PC-only feature that integrates seamlessly with Discord's Rich Presence system.

improvements.text: Hexagon Grid Option - Choose your aesthetic! New grid type preference in Settings > Display allows you to switch between the classic square grid and a beautiful hexagon honeycomb grid. The hexagon grid uses proper mathematical tessellation with point-top hexagons, creating a seamless honeycomb pattern that scales perfectly at all zoom levels. Your preference is saved with your project and persists across sessions. Try it out for a fresh visual experience while designing circuits!

Two-Finger Panning During Wire Placement (Mobile) - No more accidental camera panning while routing wires! During wire placement, single-finger drags now only interact with wire points and pins - the camera stays put. To pan the camera while placing a wire, use two fingers. This eliminates the most frustrating aspect of mobile wire routing and makes placement precise and smooth. Normal camera panning (outside wire placement) still works with one finger.

Wire Placement Banner (Mobile) - New top-screen banner appears when placing wires showing 'Placing Wire' status and current straight wires mode. Tap the banner to toggle straight wires override on/off (mobile equivalent of holding Shift on PC). Banner shows yellow tint when override is active. Respects your straight wires preference setting - if preference forces straight wires, banner shows 'ON (pref)' and isn't clickable. Provides clear visual feedback and desktop-parity control for mobile wire routing.

Trash Can Exits Wire Placement (Mobile) - Pressing the trash icon while placing a wire now cancels wire placement mode, providing an intuitive way to exit wire routing. Outside wire placement, trash icon continues to toggle eraser mode as before.

Custom Pin Names in Level Mode - You can now rename input/output pins when playing levels! Right-click any level I/O pin and choose 'Edit' to give it a custom name. Your custom pin names appear as column headers in the validation results table, making it easier to understand test results. Perfect for educational levels where descriptive names like 'CarryIn', 'Sum', 'Clock' help students understand circuit functionality. Pin names are saved with your solution.

Unified ROM Visibility and Naming - ROM chips now display with clear, consistent labeling throughout the game. The chip library shows a single 'ROM 256Ã—16' entry instead of multiple confusing variants. Every ROM chip displays a two-line label showing 'ROM' on the first line and its active configuration on the second (e.g., '256Ã—(2x8)', '256Ã—(1x16)', '256Ã—(16x1)', '256Ã—(4x4)'). Freshly spawned ROMs default to '256Ã—(2x8)' and automatically update their labels after editing. This eliminates confusion between editor and runtime views, prevents chip library duplication, and makes it instantly clear what configuration each ROM is using.

ROM Editor Mobile Optimization - Enhanced ROM editing with mobile-first design: larger touch-friendly buttons, vertical layout for easy access, row selection system (click row numbers to select), context-aware Fill 0s/Fill 1s operations, optimized spacing and responsive layout for all screen sizes.

Level Mode Chip Restrictions - Special chips (ROM, displays, pulse generators, clocks, buttons, etc.) are now disabled in level mode to maintain educational focus. Players must build circuits from fundamental logic gates (NAND, tri-state buffers) and basic components. Custom user chips remain available. Prevents trivial solutions and ensures fair leaderboard comparisons while promoting deeper understanding of digital logic design.

Draggable Scroll Views - All scrollable lists and menus now support mobile-style content dragging! Simply touch/click anywhere in the content area and drag to scroll - no need to target the tiny scrollbar. Works in ROM editor, chip library, search results, levels menu, leaderboards, patch notes, and everywhere else. Natural mobile app experience with smart threshold to prevent accidental scrolling. Scrollbar and mouse wheel still work as before.

Input State Preservation - Level validation now preserves your circuit's input states! After running validation tests, your input pins return to exactly how they were before you clicked 'Validate'. No more confusing randomly flipped inputs - the circuit looks exactly as you left it, while still showing accurate test results. This improves the polish and makes validation feel seamless.

Fixed Chip Library Navigation - Improved navigation in Chip Library Menu with consistent selection states, proper focus management, and intuitive movement between starred items, collections, and nested folders
Level validation popup improvements - Test results now scroll properly for complex circuits

bugFixes.text: CRITICAL: Fixed bit order bug in level validation - Resolved game-breaking bug where inputs/outputs were being reversed during validation, affecting all 26 levels. Game now correctly validates solutions.

newFeatures.text: Drag and Drop Control Scheme - New intuitive chip placement mode. Simply drag chips from the bottom bar and drop them directly onto the canvas. Toggle between classic 'Drag and Lock' and new 'Drag and Drop' modes in preferences.
Hierarchical Collection Organization - Create and manage sub folders within collections for better chip organization.
PC Version - Full mobile features now available on PC with mouse and keyboard support.
Solution Sharing - Upload and view complete solutions from leaderboard entries.
User Names - Add custom names when uploading scores to leaderboards.
iOS Platform Support - Full iOS support with project import/export and Firebase integration.

Patch Notes Popup - View 'What's New' directly from the About menu! See recent features, improvements, and bug fixes with color-coded sections. Easy to navigate with version selection and scrollable content.

improvements.text: PC Firebase Integration - Full Firebase functionality now works on PC builds (Windows, macOS, Linux). PC users can now upload scores, view leaderboards, share solutions, and set user names just like mobile users. All online features are now available across all platforms.
Enhanced Level System - Expanded with more challenging levels and progressive difficulty.
Improved UI Navigation - Better folder browsing and collection management.
Clearer Score Explanation - Updated scoring information to better explain how nested NAND gates are counted.
Auto-Open Edit Tool - Single component selected + wrench press now automatically opens the edit menu.

bugFixes.text: Fixed iOS file picker for importing project zip files. Various stability improvements and performance optimizations.
